availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis W. Staples (Hopkins County, KY, farmer and corporal 17th Ky Cav)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Resident of Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1863. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from January 3, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 1, p. 450B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 404.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, July 1863, p. 33.
"Lewis W. Staples (1837-1926)," Find A Grave, Memorial #64159338, accessed October 6, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64159338.
